business.headline: Think missing an EMI is harmless? The impact can last yearsMost borrowers don't plan to miss an EMI, yet life can get in the way. But what feels like a small slip today can turn into a long-term hurdle when you need credit the most.

It's not EMIs, it's FOMO: The real reason Indians can't save, says expertIt's not monthly EMIs draining Indian wallets, it's the fear of missing out. From vacations to gadgets and impulse buys, FOMO is quietly overtaking financial discipline, says an expert, making saving feel optional rather than essential.

Sensex, Nifty end higher despite profit booking; Infosys leads gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 319.07 points to close at 83,535.35, while the NSE Nifty 50 gained 82.05 points to settle at 25,574.35. Most sectoral indices also finished in the green, led by information technology, finance and metals.

Should property be a part of your long-term investment portfolio?With prices rising and rental yields improving, more Indians are turning to property as a long-term wealth investment. But should real estate really be part of your investment portfolio? Read on to find out.
Did Lenskart's high IPO valuation leave investors with no profit?Lenskart shares listed at Rs 395 on the NSE and Rs 390 on the BSE, both below the IPO issue price of Rs 402.

Selling less, earning more: Why India's real estate is earning more from lessIn FY25, around 4.22 lakh homes were sold across the top seven cities, with a total sales value of Rs 5.59 lakh crore. In FY26, ANAROCK projects this number to rise to Rs 6.65 lakh crore.

What is 'Digital Gold' and why has Sebi issued a warning?Sebi has warned investors about risks in unregulated digital gold. Experts say the move aims to protect users as India readies tighter rules for tokenised assets, so what exactly is digital gold?

Noida's retail boom: These 2 mega infra projects are driving mall growthThe Noida area has become a preferred place for retail investors and mall developers due to the proximity of expressway connectivity and the airport's vicinity.

Groww IPO allotment out: Here's how to check on BSE, NSEThe parent company of Groww, Billionbrains Garage Ventures Ltd, saw massive investor interest during the subscription window. With the allotment now underway, here's how you can find out if you've secured a piece of the company before its market debut.

Nykaa share price jumps nearly 7% after Q2 profit rise: Should you buy?Nykaa's parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures reported strong Q2 results, lifting the stock nearly 7%. Analysts see solid growth but warn that high valuations may limit further upside.

Gold and silver prices jump: Good time to buy or should you wait?Precious metals are shining brighter again. Gold and silver rates have jumped, driven by global cues and a softer dollar. But for buyers planning a purchase, the dilemma remains — lock in prices now or hold for a dip?

Sensex jumps over 500 points: Why is the stock market rising today?The Sensex surged over 500 points in afternoon trade, while the Nifty held firm above the 25,500 mark, supported by buying in banking, metal, and energy stocks. Read to know key factors behind the rally on Dalal Street.

Why more insurance claims get rejected during the festive seasonMany policyholders face claim rejections during the festive season due to confusion over policy terms, missing documents, and tighter insurer scrutiny. Experts say better awareness and clear communication can prevent disputes.

Looking for safe returns? 5 small savings schemes offering up to 8.2%Not everyone wants to gamble with their savings. If you lean towards stable and assured earnings, a few government-run schemes now offer returns of up to 8.2%, combining safety with decent interest.

Government to relax lending, rethink quality checks to boost exportersA senior government source said that the new support could include relaxed bank lending rules, better working capital access, and a review of strict quality checks that have been slowing down supply chains.

ITR mistakes to be fixed faster? Here's how CBDT's new rules can speed up refundsTaxpayers who've faced delays due to errors in their income tax returns may soon breathe easier. The CBDT has introduced new rules aimed at correcting ITR mistakes faster and speeding up refunds.

Lenskart shares list at 3% discount: Should you sell or hold?The stock opened at Rs 395 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), lower than the issue price of Rs 402. On the BSE, it listed at Rs 390, marking a discount of 2.98%.

Why Sebi is warning investors about digital gold and what makes Gold ETFs saferSebi has warned investors about digital gold sold by fintech apps, calling it unregulated and risky. Experts say investors should move to Gold ETFs and other Sebi-regulated options for safety.

Lenskart shares make dull market debut, lists at 3% below IPO priceLenskart shares made a quiet market debut on Dalal Street today, opening at Rs 390 on the BSE, down 2.98% from the issue price. On the NSE, the stock began trading at Rs 395 per share, slightly below its issue price of Rs 402.

Sebi warns against digital gold: How risky is it and should you invest?Digital gold, often marketed as a convenient way to buy small amounts of gold online, allows users to purchase, store, and sell gold through apps without ever holding it physically.

entertainment.headline: Hema Malini shares update on Dharmendra's health, urges fans to pray for him Actor Hema Malini shared an update on her husband Dharmendra's health. The 89-year-old is admitted to Breach Candy hospital in Mumbai.

Shehnaaz Gill says Bigg Boss changed her a lot, Siddharth Shukla taught maturity Actor Shehnaaz Gill opened up about her experiences on 'Bigg Boss 13' and her bond with the late Siddharth Shukla. She highlighted how Siddharth's teachings helped her mature and also reflected on his lasting impact.

Prem Chopra, 90, hospitalised in Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital Prem Chopra has been hospitalised at Lilavati hospital. His son-in-law, actor Vikas Bhalla told India Today that he was hospitalised as a precautionary measure.

Globetrotter first single out, Shruti Haasan lends vocals for SS Rajamouli film The promotions for Mahesh Babu and SS Rajamouli's highly anticipated film 'Globetrotter' are in full swing, with the team unveiling the first single composed by MM Keeravaani and sung by Shruti Haasan.

Real Kashmir Football Club trailer: An inspiring tale of courage and change The trailer of the series 'Real Kashmir Football Club' is out now.  Starring Manav Kaul and Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub, the series is inspired by the true story of how two men established Kashmir's first professional football club.

Dulquer Salmaan shares details about his upcoming Malayalam film I'm Game Dulquer Salmaan teases his stylish new role in his upcoming Malayalam film 'I'm Game' while gearing up for the release of 'Kaantha' on November 14.

Rana Daggubati: Before Baahubali, we didn't know a Rs 1,000 crore film Actor Rana Daggubati, opened up about the growing obsession with Rs 1,000-crore box-office targets, reflecting on how the definition of success changed after 'Baahubali'.

Renuka Shahane recalls married producer's proposal to live together for a campaign Renuka Shahane shared that a married producer once made an inappropriate proposal to her in front of her mother, offering work in exchange for living together. The actor also highlighted how such incidents often lead to further victimisation in the industry.

Ravi Teja's 76th film locks Sankranthi 2026 release, title glimpse out Ravi Teja's 76th film, 'Bhartha Mahasayulaku Wignyapthi', has officially joined the Sankranthi 2026 race. Directed by Kishore Tirumala, the film promises a family-friendly entertainer filled with humour, heart, and the actor's signature charm.

World's worst kept secret: Priyanka Chopra teases Globetrotter event in new video The buzz around Mahesh Babu and SS Rajamouli's upcoming film Globetrotter continues to grow, with Priyanka Chopra joining the excitement through a playful video message ahead of the grand event in Hyderabad.

Parvathy calls working with Irrfan Khan a blessing as Qarib Qarib Single turns 8 Eight years after 'Qarib Qarib Single', actor Parvathy Thiruvothu fondly remembers her Bollywood debut and calls working with the late Irrfan Khan a true blessing.

Tamannaah Bhatia dismisses ozempic rumours, says my curves are not going anywhere Tamannaah Bhatia dismissed rumours about using weight-loss drugs and opened up about embracing her natural curves, saying, "My curves are not going anywhere because I am Sindhi." The actor also reflected on her changing body and journey toward self-acceptance.

Anurag Kashyap alleges Netflix snatched CID, The Kapil Sharma Show at premium cost Director Anurag Kashyap revealed that many filmmakers stepped back from Netflix due to creative restrictions. He also reflected on the streaming platform's move to charge for previously free popular shows.

Actor Dhanush praises Dan Trachtenberg's Predator Badlands, calls it a marvel 'Tere Ishk Mein' actor Dhanush was all praises for director Dan Trachtenberg's latest science fiction action film, 'Predator: Badlands'.

Ram Gopal Varma apologises to Chiranjeevi ahead of Shiva re-release. Here's why Veteran director Ram Gopal Varma, whose 1989 classic 'Shiva' is set to re-release later this week, apologised to Telugu superstar Chiranjeevi. He also thanked him for his "large heartedness."

Karthik Subbaraj, Guneet Monga team up for new film, shoot begins in Madurai Sikhya Entertainment and acclaimed Tamil director Karthik Subbaraj begin filming a new project in Madurai, marking their first collaboration and combining award-winning production with inventive filmmaking.

I am happy he has opinions: Javed Akhtar claps back at Lucky Ali's jibe | Exclusive Poet and lyricist Javed Akhtar responded to singer Lucky Ali's recent criticism. In an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, he spoke about accepting opposing opinions while addressing Ali's "never original" jibe.

What happens at Salman Khan's house parties? Shehnaaz Gill spills details Shehnaaz Gill has offered fans a rare insight into Salman Khan's house parties. The actor shared her personal experience from one of the parties that took place during the making of 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan'.

Priyanka Chopra calls Bharti Singh next Bulgari ambassador after her viral vlog Bharti Singh flaunted her new Bulgari Serpenti watch gifted by husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa and got a sweet reaction from Priyanka Chopra herself. The global icon praised Bharti and even joked that she could be Bulgari's next ambassador.

general news.headline: Before Delhi blast, bomb-making material, rifle seized from terrorists | 5 pointsA powerful blast near Delhi's Red Fort killed eight and injured 24 on Monday evening. The blast came hours after police busted a terror module spanning Haryana, UP, and J&K. The probe has exposed a "white-collar" terror network of radicalised doctors and academics linked to Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammed.

2,900 kg bomb-making chemical seized near Delhi, rifle found in woman doctor's carMore than 2,900 kg of bomb-making material and ammonium nitrate were seized from doctors linked to a medical college in Haryana's Faridabad. Officials said there was a conspiracy to terrorise Delhi using hundreds of powerful IEDs made from the recovered explosive-making chemicals.

Hema Malini shares update on Dharmendra's health, urges fans to pray for himActor Hema Malini shared an update on her husband Dharmendra's health. The 89-year-old is admitted to Breach Candy hospital in Mumbai.

Red Fort blast: Delhi Mumbai on high alert; multiple states step up surveillanceFollowing the deadly blast outside the Red Fort, Delhi has been placed on high alert. Other cities and states, including Mumbai, Kolkata, Dehradun, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh have stepped up security measures.

Ironman: PM Modi cheers Annamalai, Tejasvi Surya for conquering Goa endurance raceTejasvi Surya and Annamalai successfully completed the Ironman 70.3 triathlon in Goa on Sunday. Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised the two young leaders for their commitment to fitness.

All angles being probed, will hold meet tomorrow: Amit Shah after Red Fort blastAn explosion occurred in a car near Gate No. 1 of Red Fort (Lal Qila) Metro Station at around 6.55 pm. The car went up in flames and several other nearby cars were also gutted.

Dharmendra under observation, pray for his speedy recovery: Actor's teamVeteran actor Dharmendra has been admitted to Mumbai's Breach Candy Hospital, but his team confirmed he is stable and recovering well. Despite rumours of him being on a ventilator, the 89-year-old star is doing fine and gearing up for his next film release in December.

Heartbreaking: President Murmu, Rahul Gandhi, others condole Delhi blast deathsAt least eight people were killed, and several others were injured after a strong blast occurred in a Hyundai i20 car near Delhi's Red Fort on Monday evening.

4 doctors arrested in 4 days with chemicals, rifles: Face of white-collar terrorFour doctors were arrested in four days for terror activities, including possession of firearms, ricin, and ammonium nitrate, revealing a threatening trend of highly educated professionals being radicalised by international handlers.

12 years on, Farhan Akhtar slams Naseeruddin Shah's Bhaag Milkha Bhaag jibeFarhan Akhtar responded to comments made by Naseeruddin Shah regarding his performance in the film 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag'. Shah said he didn't care for Farhan's performance, adding that he didn't "work hard" on acting.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

Fell thrice, thought I would die: Witness describes ferocity of Red Fort car blastThe explosion occurred in car a near Gate No. 1 of Delhi's Red Fort (Lal Qila) Metro Station on Monday evening. The car went up in flames and several other nearby cars were also gutted.

My husband cheated on me with a friend. Can he ever change?We may hate to admit it, but cheating in relationships has become more common than ever. While some slip-ups stem from momentary weakness, others are simply the pattern of a repeat offender.

The genesis of the RSS, and its history of mysteryIn 1925 Nagpur, five men met discreetly to forge a disciplined Hindu cadre. Their plan birthed an organisation that would thrive in secrecy, ideology, and influence: the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh.

Red Fort blast: Delhi's IGI Airport, railway stations on high alertFollowing the blast near the Red Fort that killed 10 and injured dozens, a high alert has been declared at New Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport. Delhi Metro stations have also been placed under heightened security. A high alert has also been sounded for all railway stations in Delhi and the National Capital Region (NCR).

I am happy he has opinions: Javed Akhtar claps back at Lucky Ali's jibe | ExclusivePoet and lyricist Javed Akhtar responded to singer Lucky Ali's recent criticism. In an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, he spoke about accepting opposing opinions while addressing Ali's "never original" jibe.

Actor Gouri Kishan, body-shamed, rejects journalist's apology, says do betterActor Gouri Kishan has criticised journalist RS Karthik's apology following his comment about her weight during a press event for the film 'Others' in Chennai.

Mystery of frequent quakes solved: Indian plate quietly breaking apartThe findings offer fresh insight into the powerful underground forces that continue to shape the Himalayas and the Tibetan Plateau.

Student from Andhra found dead in US, family seeks aid for funeral, loan duesA 23-year-old MS graduate from Texas A&M University–Corpus Christi was found dead in the US on November 7. Rajyalakshmi Yarlagadda, who was from Karanchedu in Andhra Pradesh, was looking for a job after completing her studies. The cause of death is under investigation.

Error of judgment: BBC chief apologises after backlash over Trump speech editBBC Chairperson Samir Shah on Monday said that the editing of the Trump documentary in 2024 was an "error of judgment," following the resignations of the channel's Director General Tim Davie and the network's Chief Executive of News, Deborah Turness, on Sunday.
Video: Delta pilot calms nervous passengers with heartfelt 'ice cream promise' speechA video of a Delta Airlines pilot reassuring nervous passengers has delighted the internet.

Call me bro: Pookie Rahul Gandhi meets Gen Z, displays political rizzIt looks like Congress leader Rahul Gandhi can vibe with the Gen Zers. Rahul Gandhi, while nodding to the Nepal protests and calling out vote-chori allegations, has at times spoken to the Gen Z population. A video of Rahul Gandhi speaking to Gen Zers in their lingo was uploaded on Monday. Rahul asked the Gen Zers to call him "bro".

Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium to be demolished for 102-acre sports cityJawaharlal Nehru Stadium in New Delhi will be dismantled to build a new Sports City. The project aims to modernise India's sports infrastructure as it eyes the 2036 Olympics hosting rights.

Bangladesh chaos funded by Clintons, Soros, backed by Biden, says ex-ministerFormer Bangladesh minister Mohibul Hasan Chowdhury has claimed that the 2024 protests in the nation that led to the ouster of Sheikh Hasina was no organic uprising. It was a Western-funded operation backed by the Clintons, George Soros, USAID, and the Biden administration, he claimed. His explosive claims suggest the chaos was carefully engineered by the radicals, with money to install a more pliant regime under Muhammad Yunus in Dhaka.

Hema Malini shares update on Dharmendra's health, urges fans to pray for himActor Hema Malini shared an update on her husband Dharmendra's health. The 89-year-old is admitted to Breach Candy hospital in Mumbai.
Salman Khan visits Dharmendra at Mumbai hospital. WatchActor Salman Khan arrived at Breach Candy Hospital to meet veteran Bollywood actors Dharmendra.

sports.headline: Watch: Sandesh Jhingan urges AIFF to find quick solution on ISL fiasco India defender Sandesh Jhingan has called on the AIFF to resolve the ongoing ISL crisis, warning that the uncertainty has left players, clubs, and fans in limbo as Indian football faces a worrying standstill.

Gautam Gambhir leads Indian cricket fraternity in mourning Delhi blast victims India head coach Gautam Gambhir led the cricket fraternity in mourning the victims of the Red Fort car blast, expressing grief and prayers for their families. BCCI President Mithun Manhas and former India opener Shikhar Dhawan also poured in condolences.

Security tightened at Arun Jaitley Stadium for Ranji Trophy after Delhi blast A powerful blast near Delhi's Red Fort killed at least 8 people and injured several others. Security has been increased at Arun Jaitley Stadium ahead of the Day 4 of the Ranji Trophy fixture between Delhi and Jammu & Kashmir in the aftermath of the incident.

Ajinkya Naik re-elected as Mumbai Cricket president; elections set for other posts Ajinkya Naik has been re-elected unopposed as the President of the Mumbai Cricket Association after all seven rival candidates withdrew their nominations. The MCA elections for other key posts will be held on Wednesday.

Don't see any reason why Mohammed Shami can't play for India: Sourav Ganguly Sourav Ganguly has voiced strong support for Mohammed Shami's fitness and selection in the Indian cricket team amid reports of communication between the fast bowler and selectors.

Shreyas Iyer, back from life-threatening injury, shares beach photo: Grateful India cricketer Shreyas Iyer shared a photo of himself holidaying at a beach, marking his first public appearance since recovering from a life-threatening injury. The batter suffered a lacerated spleen during a diving effort in the third ODI in Sydney, required urgent medical attention, and is currently recovering under medical supervision.

Did Gautam Gambhir take a dig at Rohit,Virat with not celebrating series losses claim? India head coach Gautam Gambhir states he never celebrates series losses as a coach. His comments have sparked debate among fans who're seeing it as an attack on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.

Sanju Samson won't captain CSK in IPL 2026 if Jadeja trade goes through: R Ashwin IPL 2026 retentions: Former India spinner R Ashwin has said Sanju Samson may not lead Chennai Super Kings next year even if the trade involving Ravindra Jadeja goes through. Ashwin also believes Jadeja joining Rajasthan Royals would be a major boost for the 2008 champions.

Fit Rohit must now prove himself by scoring 600 runs like Kohli in IPL: Kaif Mohammad Kaif feels Mumbai Indians opener Rohit Sharma must prove himself by scoring 600 runs in the upcoming IPL season, having undergone sensational fitness transformation recently.

Lionel Messi secretly visits former home Camp Nou: FC Barcelona fans get emotional Lionel Messi quietly visited his old home at Camp Nou and shared how deeply he misses Barcelona. He hinted at returning one day—not just to say farewell, but perhaps to reconnect in a new way.

Mohamed Salah slammed by Wayne Rooney after Liverpool's loss to Manchester City Wayne Rooney slammed Mohamed Salah after his poor performance in Liverpool's loss to Manchester City on Sunday, November 9. Salah has struggled for form this season as Liverpool's woes continue with the latest defeat.

Did Gautam Gambhir take a dig at Rohit,Virat with not celebrating series losses claim? India head coach Gautam Gambhir states he never celebrates series losses as a coach. His comments have sparked debate among fans who're seeing it as an attack on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.

Sanju Samson won't captain CSK in IPL 2026 if Jadeja trade goes through: R Ashwin IPL 2026 retentions: Former India spinner R Ashwin has said Sanju Samson may not lead Chennai Super Kings next year even if the trade involving Ravindra Jadeja goes through. Ashwin also believes Jadeja joining Rajasthan Royals would be a major boost for the 2008 champions.

Fit Rohit must now prove himself by scoring 600 runs like Kohli in IPL: Kaif Mohammad Kaif feels Mumbai Indians opener Rohit Sharma must prove himself by scoring 600 runs in the upcoming IPL season, having undergone sensational fitness transformation recently.

Lionel Messi secretly visits former home Camp Nou: FC Barcelona fans get emotional Lionel Messi quietly visited his old home at Camp Nou and shared how deeply he misses Barcelona. He hinted at returning one day—not just to say farewell, but perhaps to reconnect in a new way.

Mohamed Salah slammed by Wayne Rooney after Liverpool's loss to Manchester City Wayne Rooney slammed Mohamed Salah after his poor performance in Liverpool's loss to Manchester City on Sunday, November 9. Salah has struggled for form this season as Liverpool's woes continue with the latest defeat.

Dhruv Jurel has the best technique to bat at no. 3: Former India wicketkeeperFormer India wicketkeeper Deep Dasgupta has identified Dhruv Jurel as possessing the best technique for India's unsettled No. 3 spot in Test cricket. Jurel has been in sensational form of late but his place in playing XI is under question with Rishabh Pant returning to the team.

Sunil Gavaskar warns India's Women's World Cup winners of PR traps: Don't get usedIndian cricket great Sunil Gavaskar has cautioned India's Women's World Cup winners to be wary of fake promises and opportunistic brands seeking publicity, reminding them not every post-victory reward or offer may materialise.

Batting order is overrated in T20Is, we need to evolve as coaches: Gautam GabmhirGautam Gambhir said India cannot afford to think traditionally in T20Is. The head coach said he wants a side where players move up and down the order, focus on impact, and are ready to play different roles in the lead-up to next year's T20 World Cup.

Gambhir slams conspiracy theories on team selection: Dressing room is transparentIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir recently addressed criticism over benching key players. He emphasised transparent communication to maintain team harmony and slammed baseless conspiracy theories.

Mamata Banerjee promises cricket stadium named after Richa Ghosh in DarjeelingWest Bengal Cheif Minister Mamata Banerjee honoured the state's World Cup hero Richa Ghosh, as she announced the plans for a new stadium named after the wicketkeeper-batter.

Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium to be demolished for 102-acre sports cityJawaharlal Nehru Stadium in New Delhi will be dismantled to build a new Sports City. The project aims to modernise India's sports infrastructure as it eyes the 2036 Olympics hosting rights.

Why Sanju Samson's IPL trade to Delhi Capitals from RR collapsed: ReportSanju Samson is reportedly close to exiting the Rajasthan Royals to join the Chennai Super Kings. However, earlier this year, the Indian wicketkeeper-batter was on the verge of moving to the Delhi Capitals. Here's a look at why the deal with DC eventually fell through.

Mamata Banerjee promises cricket stadium named after Richa Ghosh in DarjeelingWest Bengal Cheif Minister Mamata Banerjee honoured the state's World Cup hero Richa Ghosh, as she announced the plans for a new stadium named after the wicketkeeper-batter.

Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium to be demolished for 102-acre sports cityJawaharlal Nehru Stadium in New Delhi will be dismantled to build a new Sports City. The project aims to modernise India's sports infrastructure as it eyes the 2036 Olympics hosting rights.

Why Sanju Samson's IPL trade to Delhi Capitals from RR collapsed: ReportSanju Samson is reportedly close to exiting the Rajasthan Royals to join the Chennai Super Kings. However, earlier this year, the Indian wicketkeeper-batter was on the verge of moving to the Delhi Capitals. Here's a look at why the deal with DC eventually fell through.

Liverpool are in crisis: Roy Keane makes big claim after Manchester City lossManchester United legend Roy Keane believes Liverpool is in crisis at the moment following their 3-0 loss to Manchester City on Sunday, November 9. The Reds' poor run of recent form continued with the hammering they received at the Etihad Stadium.

MS Dhoni will play IPL 2026: Raina picks CSK retentions, makes big Jadeja callFormer Chennai Super Kings batter Suresh Raina has laid out his retention and release plans for CSK ahead of IPL 2026, insisting that MS Dhoni and Ravindra Jadeja remain untouchable while pushing for fresh changes to the squad.

Captain Temba Bavuma joins South Africa squad in Kolkata ahead of 1st TestSouth Africa captain Temba Bavuma was the final player to join the senior squad on Monday morning as the visitors assembled in full strength in Kolkata ahead of the opening Test against India, scheduled to begin at Eden Gardens on Friday.

Can BCCI help Indian football recover from its ISL fiasco?With the Indian Super League hanging by a thread and clubs struggling to survive, calls have grown for the BCCI to step in. But can cricket's financial powerhouse really rescue Indian football, or just inspire it?

Ravindra Jadeja's Instagram account vanishes as CSK exit rumours growRavindra Jadeja's Instagram account has vanished as the rumours of his exit from CSK continue to gather steam. Jadeja is being linked with a swap deal with Sanju Samson that will see him return to RR.

MS Dhoni will sacrifice Ravindra Jadeja to get Sanju Samson for CSK's good: KaifMohammed Kaif has claimed that MS Dhoni will be ready to sacrifice Ravindra Jadeja to get Sanju Samson for CSK's good. Kaif feels that Dhoni will want to make Chennai champions again and he will allow the trade to happen. ,

Robert Lewandowski hat-trick powers Barcelona to thumping win over Celta VigoBarcelona secured a vital 4–2 win away at Celta Vigo, with Robert Lewandowski scoring a hat-trick, as the team moved within three points of league leaders Real Madrid ahead of the international break.

Renuka Singh overwhelmed by villagers' tribute after India's World Cup triumphIndian pacer Renuka Thakur was overwhelmed after receiving a hero's welcome on Sunday upon her return to her ancestral village, Parsa, in the Rohru subdivision of Shimla district, following India's historic triumph at the 2025 ICC Women's World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
